content.question: The complete photoelectron spectrum of an element is given above. Which of the following electron configurations is consistent with the spectrum?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 6, 3 s 2, 3 p 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 s 2, 2 s 2, 2 p 6, 3 s 2, 3 p 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
